contextId.information: "after John was placed in prison." This can be stated in active form. AT: "after they arrested John" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: after John was arrested

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the people there heard that he was staying at his home" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it was heard that he was at home

contextId.information: Jesus makes clear why God established the Sabbath. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God made the Sabbath for mankind" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The Sabbath was made for mankind

contextId.information: This can be stated with an active form. AT: "Jesus restored his hand" or "Jesus made his hand the way it was before" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: his hand was restored

contextId.information: This refers to the young plants. This may be stated in active form. AT: "it scorched the young plants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they were scorched

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to him God will give more ... from him God will take away" or "God will give more to him ... God will take away from him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to him will be given more ... from him will be taken away

contextId.information: This can be written in active form. AT: "People had bound him many times" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He had been bound many times

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and heal her and make her live" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that she may be made well and live

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "it will heal me" or "his power will heal me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I will be healed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Herod sent his soldiers to arrest John and had them bind him in prison" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Herod sent to have John arrested and he had him bound in prison

contextId.information: The phrase "his sight was restored" can be written in active form. AT: "restoring the man's sight, and then the man opened his eyes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and the man opened his eyes, his sight was restored

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and that the elders and the chief priests and the scribes would reject him, and that men would kill him and after three days he would rise up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and would be rejected by the elders ... and after three days rise up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he appeared very different" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was transfigured

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and for God to throw you into hell" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and be thrown into hell

contextId.information: This can be stated in the active form. AT: "for God to throw you into hell" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be thrown into hell

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which I will endure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: with which I am baptized

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has prepared it" or "God has prepared them"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it has been prepared

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "those whom the people consider to be the rulers of the Gentiles" or "those who rule over the Gentiles" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who are considered rulers of the Gentiles

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form or as as a direct quote. AT: "commanded others to call him" or "commanded them, 'Call him to come over here.'" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: commanded him to be called

contextId.information: This can be written in active form. AT: "that no one has ever ridden" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that has never been ridden

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they do not marry, and no one gives them in marriage" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: are given in marriage

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will certainly punish them with greater condemnation" or "God will certainly punish them severely" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: These men will receive greater condemnation

contextId.information: It is implied that enemy soldiers will tear down the stones. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Not one stone will remain on top of another, for enemy soldiers will come and destroy these buildings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Not one stone will be left on another which will not be torn down

contextId.information: This means that the authorities will sentence them to be put to death. This can be stated in active form. AT: "cause the authorities to sentence them to die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: cause them to be put to death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "wherever my followers preach the gospel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: wherever the gospel is preached

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will scatter the sheep" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the sheep will be scattered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that he had wrapped around himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that was wrapped around him

contextId.information: Pilate told his soliders to take Jesus away to crucify him. This can be stated in active form. AT: "told his soldiers to take him away and crucify him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: then handed him over to be crucified

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone had rolled away the stone" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the stone had been rolled away

contextId.information: The angel is emphatically stating that Jesus has risen from the dead. This can be translated in active form. AT: "He arose!" or "God raised him from the dead!" or "He raised himself from the dead!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He is risen!

contextId.information: The word "he" refers to anyone. This clause can be made active. AT: "God will condemn all people who do not believe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he who does not believe will be condemned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God took him up into heaven, and he sat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was taken up into heaven and sat
